snippet: Jume Tahir, the head of China’s largest mosque, was attacked after morning prayers in Kashgar in the troubled region of Xinjiang.
abstract: Chinese religious leader Jume Tahir, vocal defender of Communist Party’s ethnic policies in the troubled region of Xinjiang, is stabbed to death in city of Kashgar; police shoot and kill two suspects and apprehend third man; crime is most likely retaliation for his support for China’s increasingly hard-line governance of Xinjiang, pivotal region that is home to China’s Uighur minority.
lead_paragraph: Jume Tahir, the head of China’s largest mosque, was attacked after morning prayers in Kashgar in the troubled region of Xinjiang.

headline.main: Imam in China Who Defended Party’s Policies in Xinjiang Is Stabbed to Death
headline.print_headline: Imam in China Who Defended Party’s Policies in Xinjiang Is Stabbed to Death
